info.title: VMware Cloud Director Availability API Reference
info.description: The VMware Cloud Director Availability API enables user session management, system monitoring and replication management and monitoring, in VMware Cloud Director Availability.

tags.description: Diagnostics, health, and support bundles operations

get.summary: Get health information about the Cloud service
get.description:
This request returns the following health information about the Cloud service:
  • can the Cloud service access its database

  • can the Cloud service communicate with the vCenter Server Lookup service

  • can the Cloud service communicate with the VMware Cloud Director

  • can the Cloud service communicate with the Tunnel service

  • can the Cloud service communicate with the Manager service

parameters.name: operationID
parameters.description: Operation ID for correlating logs across multiple services

post.summary: Create a new Cloud service session
post.description:
This request creates a new Cloud service session. The supported authentication methods are the following:
  • with SSO credentials ```json { "type": "ssoCredentials", "username": "ssoUser", "password": "ssoPass", "principal" : null } ```
  • with SSO SAML token ```json { "type": "ssoToken", "samlToken": "...", "timestamp": 1465194049081, "nonce": "jF845646gJzx734", "signature": "c2FtcGxlU2lnbmF0dXJlCg==", "principal" : null } ```
  • with VMware Cloud Director credentials ```json { "type": "vcdCredentials", "vcdUser": "admin1@org2", "vcdPassword": "password" } ```
  • with VMware Cloud Director auth cookie: ```json { "type": "vcdCookie", "vcdCookie": "f12977876fef48a6b032ffdb2cdf22d7" } ```
  • with VMware Cloud Director access token (jwt): ```json { "type": "vcdAccessToken", "vcdAccessToken": "eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiJ9....", "context": "acme-dr" } ```
  • OS root credentials: ```json { "type": "localUser", "localUser": "root", "localPassword": "password" } ```

parameters.name: operationID
parameters.description: Operation ID for correlating logs across multiple services

401.description: The returned error codes include (but are not limited to): NotAuthenticated

value.stacktrace: (The server stacktrace is provided only when the client has administrator privileges)

500.description: The returned error codes include (but are not limited to): GeneralServerFailure

value.msg: Operation aborted due to an unexpected error.
value.stacktrace: (The server stacktrace is provided only when the client has administrator privileges)

post.summary: Extend the session to a remote site
post.description:
To perform replication management operations for remote sites, provide the session with credentials (VMware Cloud Director auth cookie or access token or org user and password) for the specified remote site. The supported authentication methods are the following:
  • with VMware Cloud Director credentials: ```json { "type": "credentials", "site": "site1", "vcdUsername": "admin1@org2", "vcdPassword": "password" } ```
  • with VMware Cloud Director auth cookie: ```json { "type": "cookie", "site": "site1", "cookie": "f12977876fef48a6b032ffdb2cdf22d7" } ```
  • with VMware Cloud Director access token (jwt): ```json { "type": "vcdAccessToken", "site": "site1", "vcdAccessToken": "eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiJ9...." } ```
  • with VMware Cloud Director Multisite: ```json { "type": "multisite", "site": "site1", "org": "acme-dr" } ```

get.summary: Get the tasks
get.description: This request returns information about the tasks.

parameters.name: operationID
parameters.description: Operation ID for correlating logs across multiple services

parameters.name: site
parameters.description: Optional site to retrieve the task from. Could be a remote site or the local one.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: If present, the returned tasks' IDs will be in the given list. Comma-separated task IDs are expected.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: If present, applies equals filtering by username. Available only to admins.

parameters.name: sourceOrg
parameters.description: Optional case sensitive filtering field.

parameters.name: destinationOrg
parameters.description: Optional case sensitive filtering field, available only to admins. If present, filtering by user is not supported.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: If present, applies equals filtering by state. Available values: [RUNNING, SUCCEEDED, FAILED]

parameters.name: startTimeBefore
parameters.description: If present, applies less-than filtering by startTime.

parameters.name: startTimeAfter
parameters.description: If present, applies greater-than filtering by startTime.

parameters.name: endTimeBefore
parameters.description: If present, applies less-than filtering by endTime.

parameters.name: endTimeAfter
parameters.description: If present, applies greater-than filtering by endTime.

parameters.name: type

patch.description:
This request allows administrators to change the owner of the specified vApp replication. By default, replications are owned by the user that started them. Any replication started by an administrator user would not be visible to the respective org, unless the administrator explicitly changes ownership of the replication to the org.
Alternatively, an administrator can temporarily take ownership of a replication to prevent the tenant from seeing or managing the replication while troubleshooting or an emergency recovery is in progress.
Changing the owner of the vApp replication results in the owner of the child VM replications being set to the same value.

If one of the fields ends with a hyphen, the direction for this field will be descending. This allows chaining e.g. col,col2-,col3 will result in sorting by col (asc), then by col2 (desc) and finally by col3 (asc). Supported fields: [name, sourceSite, sourceOrg, sourceVdcName, destinationOrg, destinationVdcName, site, owner, lastUpdated]. If this field is omitted, the result is sorted by last update time in descending order.

patch.description:
This request allows administrators to change the owner of the specified VM replication. By default, replications are owned by the user that started them. Any replications started by an administrator user would not be visible to the respective org, unless the administrator explicitly changes ownership of the replication to the org.
Alternatively, an administrator can temporarily take ownership of a replication in order to prevent the tenant from seeing or managing the replication while troubleshooting or an emergency recovery is in progress.

macAddress.description: The MAC address of the NIC.

needsCustomization.description: Flag to signify if the NIC needs customization.

network.description: The name of the network to which the NIC is attached.

nicIndex.description: Index of the NIC starting from 0 in a VM.

resetMacAddress.description: Indicates whether the NIC MAC address should be reset (regenerated) or kept as it is.

consolidate.description: Indicates whether PITs should be consolidated or nothing should happen in the recovered VM. Defaults to false.

vAppId.description: The VMware Cloud Director vApp on the destination site that holds the recovered VM (only populated if one or more VMs belonging to the same source vApp are recovered on the destination site.)

vcdVmId.description: The recovered VMware Cloud Director VM on the destination site.

type.description: Polymorphic discriminator property, value can be one of: vcenter => VcFailoverSettings, vcloud => VmFailoverSettings
Polymorphic discriminator property, value can be one of: vcenter => VcFailoverTestSettings, vcloud => VmFailoverTestSettings

computerName.description: VMware Cloud Director VM computer name.

dataConnectionState.description: Shows the replication traffic (data) connection health. Possible values: [SYNCING, INITIAL_SYNCING, OK, PAUSED, POWERED_OFF, PRUNING, FINISHED, UNKNOWN, ERROR]

destinationState.description: State of the replication on the destination site.

id.description: The VM-level replication ID.

isMigration.description: True if the VM replication is a migration. Otherwise, it's a protection.

isPaused.description: Indicates whether the underlying VM replication is paused.

isReversed.description: Whether the replication is reversed. Note this flag gets inverted on each reverse, so only the odd reversed replication will show 'true'.

lastUpdated.description: The startTime of the latest task associated with this vm replication.

metadata.description: VMware Cloud Director metadata for the VM.

overallHealth.description: Representation of the replication health suitable for UI purposes.

owner.description: The organisation that owns the replication

slaProfile.description: The SLA profile used by the replication.

sourceState.description: State of the replication on the source site.

sourceVmEncrypted.description: Whether the replicated VM is encrypted.

startupInfo.description: VMware Cloud Director startupInfo for the VM.

vimLocation.description: Provides vCenter Server coordinates for an ongoing destination replication to admin users.

type.description: Polymorphic discriminator property, value can be one of: vcenter => VcPlannedMigrationSettings, vcloud => VmPlannedMigrationSettings

dataConnectionType.description: What LWD traffic mode is supported. Can be PLAIN, ENCRYPTED or ENCRYPTED_COMPRESSED.

excludedDiskKeys.description: A list of device keys of non-replicated disks.

initialSyncTime.description: Replication initial sync time. If in the past, 0 or negative, the sync will not be delayed. The time is specified as the difference, measured in milliseconds, between the current time and midnight, January 1, 1970 UTC

quiesced.description: Replicated image guest quiescing - if empty/omitted no change will be applied.

retentionPolicy.description: Replication instance retention policy - how many instances for what time to retain.

rpo.description: Recovery point objective in minutes - if empty/omitted no change will be applied.

targetDiskType.description: Optional type of virtual disks created on DR site. Possible values are: [THIN, PREALLOCATED, PREALLOCATED_ZEROS].

order.description: Boot order number of the VM.

startDelay.description: Start delay for the VM in milliseconds.

stopDelay.description: Stop delay for the VM in milliseconds.

resourceId.description: Id of the resource associated with the task. Some tasks don't have a resourceId.

resourceName.description: Name of the resource associated with the task. Some resources don't have a name.

resourceType.description: Type of the resource associated with the task.
